prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: We request default settings for continuum observations.

We request 0.3 arcsec angular resolution from following two reasons. 1. In previous study (Ikarashi et al. 2014), we found that observed bright AzTEC sources at z>3 have size of 0.2 arcsec (FWHM, median). 2. One of our science goal is comparison with HST WFC3 image (PSF~0.2 arcsec).

In SBs of Faint sources1, 2, 3 and 4, we observe fainter AzTEC sources with flux density at 1.1 mm of 1.3-2.0 mJy. In previous our ALMA cycle-1 program, we found that >~30% of AzTEC sources turned our to be multiple. So here we assume the case that an AzTEC source are divided to two sources with a half of AzTEC flux each. In order to estimate required sensitivity conservatively, we assume the worst case that we detect the sources at the edge of FoV with the half sensitivity. From the experience in our cycle-1 studies (Ikarashi et al. 2014), >10 sigma detection at peak is required for source size measurement. However by taking account into the higher angular resolution which we request, we request >8 sigma deteciton at peak. Here we assume detection of AzTEC 1.5 mJy source by tacking account into the flux error. The requested sensitivity is 1.5/2/2/8=0.047 mJy/beam.

Our sample comes from our AzTEC/ASTE surveys at observing wavelength of 1.1 mm. ALMA observation at same wavelength is promissing. In addition, comparison ALMA flux with AzTEC flux is important to think about the possible missing flux by ALMA.
We request default settings for continuum observations.

We request 0.3 arcsec angular resolution from following two reasons. 1. In previous study (Ikarashi et al. 2014), we found that observed bright AzTEC sources at z>3 have size of 0.2 arcsec (FWHM, median). 2. One of our science goal is comparison with HST WFC3 image (PSF~0.2 arcsec).

However by taking account into the higher angular resolution which we request, we request >8 sigma deteciton at peak. Here we assume detection of AzTEC 1.5 mJy source by tacking account into the flux error. The requested sensitivity is 1.5/2/2/8=0.047 mJy/beam.

We request default settings for continuum observations.

In previous our ALMA cycle-1 program, we found that >~30% of AzTEC sources turned our to be multiple. So here we assume the case that an AzTEC source are divided to two sources with a half of AzTEC flux each. In order to estimate required sensitivity conservatively, we assume the worst case that we detect the sources at the edge of FoV with the half sensitivity. From the experience in our cycle-1 studies (Ikarashi et al. 2014), >10 sigma detection at peak is required for source size measurement. However by taking account into the higher angular resolution which we request, we request >8 sigma deteciton at peak. Here we assume detection of AzTEC 1.5 mJy source by tacking account into the flux error. The requested sensitivity is 1.5/2/2/8=0.047 mJy/beam.

We request default settings for continuum observations.

We request 0.3 arcsec angular resolution from following two reasons. 1. In previous study (Ikarashi et al. 2014), we found that observed bright AzTEC sources at z>3 have size of 0.2 arcsec (FWHM, median). 2. One of our science goal is comparison with HST WFC3 image (PSF~0.2 arcsec).

In SBs of Faint sources1, 2, 3 and 4, we observe fainter AzTEC sources with flux density at 1.1 mm of 1.3-2.0 mJy. In previous our ALMA cycle-1 program, we found that >~30% of AzTEC sources turned our to be multiple. So here we assume the case that an AzTEC source are divided to two sources with a half of AzTEC flux each. In order to estimate required sensitivity conservatively, we assume the worst case that we detect the sources at the edge of FoV with the half sensitivity. From the experience in our cycle-1 studies (Ikarashi et al. 2014), >10 sigma detection at peak is required for source size measurement. However by taking account into the higher angular resolution which we request, we request >8 sigma deteciton at peak. Here we assume detection of AzTEC 1.5 mJy source by tacking account into the flux error. The requested sensitivity is 1.5/2/2/8=0.047 mJy/beam.

Our sample comes from our AzTEC/ASTE surveys at observing wavelength of 1.1 mm. ALMA observation at same wavelength is promissing. In addition, comparison ALMA flux with AzTEC flux is important to think about the possible missing flux by ALMA.
We request default settings for continuum observations.

We request 0.3 arcsec angular resolution from following two reasons. 1. In previous study (Ikarashi et al. 2014), we found that observed bright AzTEC sources at z>3 have size of 0.2 arcsec (FWHM, median). 2. One of our science goal is comparison with HST WFC3 image (PSF~0.2 arcsec).

In this SB of Bright sources1, we observe fainter AzTEC sources with flux density at 1.1 mm of 2.2-4.4 mJy. In previous our ALMA cycle-1 program, we found that >~30% of AzTEC sources turned our to be multiple. So here we assume the case that an AzTEC source are divided to two sources with a half of AzTEC flux each. In order to estimate required sensitivity conservatively, we assume the worst case that we detect the sources at the edge of FoV with the half sensitivity. From the experience in our cycle-1 studies (Ikarashi et al. 2014), >10 sigma detection at peak is required for source size measurement. However by taking account into the higher angular resolution which we request, we request >8 sigma deteciton at peak. Here we assume detection of AzTEC 2.2 mJy source by tacking account into the flux error. The requested sensitivity is 1.5/2/2/8=0.068 mJy/beam.

Our sample comes from our AzTEC/ASTE surveys at observing wavelength of 1.1 mm. ALMA observation at same wavelength is promissing. In addition, comparison ALMA flux with AzTEC flux is important to think about the possible missing flux by ALMA.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose high-fidelity 0.3-arcsec-resolution 265-GHz continuum imaging of the full sample of 38 AzTEC sources in CANDELS-UDS. We exploit the deepest, sharpest images from ALMA and HST. Our primary science goals are:
1. How common are `CANDELS-dropout' SMGs? How many dust-enshrouded star-forming galaxies have been missed in the deepest HST images?
2. In our Cycle-1 program, we discovered that z>3 SMGs have small millimetric. However, the sample was biased in redshift (z>3) and luminosity L_IR~2-4x10^12 Lo. Here, we plan to measure the size of SMGs covering z~1-6 and a wider range of L_IR, 0.8-10 x 10^12 Lo.
3. Are high-z SMGs the progenitors of massive compact quiescent galaxies at z~2? We will compare the near-IR morphologies with those of the millimetre components in SMGs as a function of redshift.
ALMA continuum mapping of the entire of CANDELS-UDS, with the same sensitivity as our proposed observations, would take >200 hrs. Conversely, combining AzTEC sources with the deepest multi-wavelength images across CANDELS-UDS is the most sensible and efficient approach for the proposed studies. Our proposed 6.7-hr ALMA observations will yield genuinely fundamental results.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe
